definition: lightning/electricity/electric (bound form)/to get (or give) an electric shock/phone call or telegram etc/to send via telephone or telegram etc

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)

sentences.english: The community's electronic eye has left the thieves nowhere to hide.
sentences.chinese: 社區電子眼，令小偷小摸無處遁形。

sentences.english: The CCD is the digital camera's electronic eye.
sentences.chinese: 而CCD就是數碼相機的電子眼。

sentences.english: If we set up more electric eyes on the road, less accidents will happen.
sentences.chinese: 如果我們在路上設更多電子眼，將會發生更少事故。

sentences.english: Bomb disposal robots can look at suspect packages with their cameras.
sentences.chinese: 炸彈解決機器人能經過它們的電子眼發覺疑惑的包袱。

definition: civil transport/movement aimed at the masses/democracy movement (abbr.)
to monitor/to keep an eye on
vehicle/(more specifically) mobility vehicle (mobility scooter, electric wheelchair, Segway etc)
Kanting township in Pingtung County 屏東縣|屏东县[Ping2 dong1 Xian4], Taiwan
(jocularly) public building that has been lying idle (and is thus ideal for housing mosquitos) (Tw)
